summary: Tyre is an ancient city in Lebanon, believed to be one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities globally. It was a significant Phoenician center and is known for its rich history and archaeological sites, including the Tyre Hippodrome. The city has faced various challenges, including periods of small population and refugee settlements. Despite this, Tyre remains the fourth largest city in Lebanon and is recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its historical significance.
title: Tyre, Lebanon
